channel.title: CloudArmy Podcast
channel.description: Behavioural science is good for marketing, but is it good elsewhere in the business? Richard talks to Jez Groom, CEO of Cowry Consulting and author of the book Ripple, about how behavioural science can positively impact your business. Jez talks about persuasive language in the service role in an organization that not only helps the customer get to a positive outcome but also strengthens the employee's ability to provide that outcome. The conversation explores other roles, including human resources and management, ultimately believing that applying these principles in your business is good and ethical!

item.title: 13 Behavioural Science is Good Business
item.description: Behavioural science is good for marketing, but is it good elsewhere in the business? Richard talks to Jez Groom, CEO of Cowry Consulting and author of the book Ripple, about how behavioural science can positively impact your business. Jez talks about persuasive language in the service role in an organization that not only helps the customer get to a positive outcome but also strengthens the employee's ability to provide that outcome. The conversation explores other roles, including human resources and management, ultimately believing that applying these principles in your business is good and ethical!
item.itunes:subtitle: cloud.army
item.itunes:summary: Behavioural science is good for marketing, but is it good elsewhere in the business? Richard talks to Jez Groom, CEO of Cowry Consulting and author of the book Ripple, about how behavioural science can positively impact your business. Jez talks about persuasive language in the service role in an organization that not only helps the customer get to a positive outcome but also strengthens the employee's ability to provide that outcome. The conversation explores other roles, including human resources and management, ultimately believing that applying these principles in your business is good and ethical!

item.title: 12 Change for the Better
item.description: Can neuroscience help make a better world? Richard talks to Madeleine Croucher of Ogilvy about the book Change for the Better, which explores the use of behavioural science to help charities engage with contributors and support their charities effectively. Maddie talks about how a deeper understanding of how effective testing of people's beliefs and perceptions can help to craft messages that trigger empathy and engagement in a cause.
item.itunes:subtitle: cloud.army

Richard talks to Madeleine Croucher of Ogilvy about the book Change for the Better, which explores the use of behavioural science to help charities engage with contributors and support their charities effectively. Maddie talks about how a deeper understanding of how effective testing of people's beliefs and perceptions can help to craft messages that trigger empathy and engagement in a cause.
item.itunes:author: cloud.army

item.title: 11 Audio and Neuro
item.description: Richard chats with Steve Kellar, audio alchemist and sonic strategist at SXM Media. Steve talks about the power of sound to affect people, and whether that is the sound of a product itself, the spoken word, an audio logo, jingle, or music track. The discussion digs into how sounds can help amplify a mood to reinforce a brand and the broader ideas of audio landscapes and environments. Sounds can elicit more robust emotional responses than many other communication methods - it's worth taking control of them.
item.itunes:subtitle: cloud.army

Sounds can elicit more robust emotional responses than many other communication methods - it's worth taking control of them.
item.itunes:author: cloud.army

item.title: 10 When Nudging Meets Neuro
item.description: In this episode, Richard talks to Rory Sutherland, vice chairman at Ogilvy UK and the author of Alchemy: The Power of Ideas that Don't Make Sense. Rory discusses the power of nudging as a marketing strategy, combining the variety of efforts organizations can use to move customers toward making buying decisions. This leads to a discussion on the role of neuroscience to make those nudges more effective by understanding how people respond to the various nudge approaches - no one size fits all!
item.itunes:subtitle: cloud.army

item.title: 9 Evolutionary Psychology
item.description: In this episode, Richard talks to Sam Tatam, global head of behavioural science at Ogilvy, about the role of evolutionary psychology and behavioural science can work together to connect with people. Sam talks about systematically approaching creativity embracing the solutions of the past to improve the future. Sam is also the author of Evolutionary Ideas, which digs deeply into the ancient innovations that can solve tomorrow's challenges.
item.itunes:subtitle: cloud.army

Sam talks about systematically approaching creativity embracing the solutions of the past to improve the future. Sam is also the author of Evolutionary Ideas, which digs deeply into the ancient innovations that can solve tomorrow's challenges.
item.itunes:author: cloud.army

item.title: 8 Behavioral Economics and Neuroscience
item.description: In this episode, Richard talks to Melina Palmer, behavioral economist and founder of Brainy Business, about her book “What Your Customer Wants and Can’t Tell You.” Melina discusses various behavioral economic concepts that can be applied to understand what customers want and how neuroscience can help you effectively test those concepts.
item.itunes:subtitle: cloud.army
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Richard talks to Melina Palmer, behavioral economist and founder of Brainy Business, about her book “What Your Customer Wants and Can’t Tell You.” Melina discusses various behavioral economic concepts that can be applied to understand what customers want and how neuroscience can help you effectively test those concepts.
item.itunes:author: cloud.army

item.title: 7 Measuring Emotional Response to Creative Works
item.description: In this episode, Richard talks to Callum Gould, Head of Insights for Saddington Baynes. Callum talks about measuring emotional response to creative works using neuroscience – that each step of the way in creating advertisements, neuroscience can help tune the creative process.
item.itunes:subtitle: cloud.army
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Richard talks to Callum Gould, Head of Insights for Saddington Baynes. Callum talks about measuring emotional response to creative works using neuroscience – that each step of the way in creating advertisements, neuroscience can help tune the creative process.
item.itunes:author: cloud.army

item.title: 6 Memory and Habits
item.description: Richard talks with Dr. Sarah Yu about how memory works and how habits are formed in the minds of consumers. Dr. Yu shares lessons about attention, memory, repetition, and habits from her years of practical experience helping some of the world's most successful brands.
item.itunes:subtitle: cloud.army
item.itunes:summary: Richard talks with Dr. Sarah Yu about how memory works and how habits are formed in the minds of consumers. Dr. Yu shares lessons about attention, memory, repetition, and habits from her years of practical experience helping some of the world's most successful brands.
item.itunes:author: cloud.army

item.title: 5 Implicit Association Deep Dive
item.description: In this episode Richard talks with Dr. Andy Baron about Implicit Association testing and how it can be used by marketers. Join us for an in depth journey into the academic origins of implicit association and how they can be applied to practical marketing problems.
item.itunes:subtitle: cloud.army
item.itunes:summary: In this episode Richard talks with Dr. Andy Baron about Implicit Association testing and how it can be used by marketers. Join us for an in depth journey into the academic origins of implicit association and how they can be applied to practical marketing problems.
item.itunes:author: cloud.army

item.title: 4 From lab to behaviour: Consumer Neuroscience In Context
item.description: In this interview with Dr. Brendan Murray, Richard delves into the complexities of how to get value from Consumer Neuroscience testing. Brendan explains why one size does not fit all and when "context is everything" how to determine the right tool for the job.
item.itunes:subtitle: cloud.army
item.itunes:summary: In this interview with Dr. Brendan Murray, Richard delves into the complexities of how to get value from Consumer Neuroscience testing. Brendan explains why one size does not fit all and when "context is everything" how to determine the right tool for the job.
item.itunes:author: cloud.army

item.title: 3 Leverage Neuroscience to Reshape Marketplace Behavior
item.description: In this episode Richard talks with Michael Smith about applying brain-based principles and insights to marketing.
item.itunes:subtitle: cloud.army
item.itunes:summary: In this episode Richard talks with Michael Smith about applying brain-based principles and insights to marketing.
item.itunes:author: cloud.army

item.title: 2 Consumer Neuroscience Testing
item.description: Richard interviews Darren Bridger, author of numerous books including: "Decoding the Irrational Consumer", "NeuroDesign", and most recently the "Implicit Test Designers Playbook".
item.itunes:subtitle: cloud.army
item.itunes:summary: Richard interviews Darren Bridger, author of numerous books including: "Decoding the Irrational Consumer", "NeuroDesign", and most recently the "Implicit Test Designers Playbook".
item.itunes:author: cloud.army

item.title: 1 What is Consumer Neuroscience?
item.description: Richard interviews Thom Noble in this introductory episode, exploring the beginnings of consumer neuroscience research and what drove market researchers to look to science for answers.
item.itunes:subtitle: cloud.army
item.itunes:summary: Richard interviews Thom Noble in this introductory episode, exploring the beginnings of consumer neuroscience research and what drove market researchers to look to science for answers.
